intro: Benthamidia hongkongensis, commonly known as Hong Kong benthamidia, is a flowering plant native to Hong Kong. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its slender, aromatic stems and small, white flowers that bloom in late summer. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
